intro: Mentha vallesiaca, commonly known as Valdese mint, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of purple or white. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a strong, minty aroma, making it a popular choice for culinary and medicinal uses. Mentha vallesiaca thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands and forests.
